data.test_name: Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry Test - 6

1.q_string: The approximate radius of a \(H\)-atom is \(0.05 nm\), and that of proton is \(1.5 \times 10^{-15}\). Assuming both the hydrogen and the proton to be spherical, calculate the fraction of the space in an atom of hydrogen that is occupied by the nucleus.

A gaseous mixture of propane and butane of volume \(3 L\) on complete combustion produces \(10 L\) of \(CO _{2}\) under standard conditions of temperature and pressure. The ratio of volumes of propane to butane is:
The vapour density of a mixture containing \(NO _{2}\) and \(N _{2} O _{4}\) is 27.6. The mole fraction of \(NO _{2}\) in the mixture will be :
The oxide of a metal contains \(52.91 \%\) of the metal. If the formula of the metal oxide is \(M _{2} O _{3}\), what is the atomic mass of the metal?

q_option: be a function of the molecular mass of the substance
1.q_string: If we take 1/6 in place of 1/12 mass of carbon atom to be the relative atomic mass unit, the mass of one mole of a substance will:
Q. Number of carbon atoms given by a young man to his bride to be, if the engagement ring contains \(0.50\) carat diamond ( 1 carat \(=200 mg\) ) is

A mixture of aluminium and zinc weighing \(1.67\) grams was completely dissolved in acid and \(1.69\) litres of hydrogen gas was evolved. The hydrogen gas was measured at STP conditions. What was the mass percent of aluminium in original mixture?
A mixture of \(CuO\) and \(Cu _{2} O\) contains \(88 \%\) of \(Cu\). The percentage of \(CuO\) in the mixture is (as nearest integer):
A quantity of \(1.4 g\) of a hydrocarbon gives \(1.8 g\) water on complete combustion. The empirical formula of hydrocarbon is :
A hydrocarbon contains 10.5 g of carbon per g of H. If one litre vapour of hydrocarbon at 127° C and 1 atm pressure weighs 2.8 g, then the molecular formula of hydrocarbon is:

What is the number of moles of Fe(OH)3 that can be produced by allowing 1 mole of F2S3, 2 moles of H2O and 3 moles of O2 to react?
2Fe2S3 + 6H2O + 3O2 → 4Fe(OH)3 + 6S
<font face="Arial" size="2">The hydrated salt Na<sub>2</sub>CO<sub>3</sub>.nH<sub>2</sub>O undergoes 63% loss in mass on heating and becomes anhydrous. The value of n is</font>

Directions: The following question has four choices, out of which ONLY ONE is correct.

Consider the reaction:

VO + Fe2O3 → FeO + V2O5

Calculate the weight of FeO produced from 2 g of VO and 5.75 g of Fe2O3.

[Take atomic weights of V and Fe to be 51 u and 56 u, respectively.]

The mole fraction of a solute in a solution is 0.1. At 298 K, molarity of this solution is the same as its molality. The density of this solution at 298 K is 2.0 g cm<sup>-3</sup>. The ratio of the molecular weight of the solute to that of the solvent is:
<font face="Arial" size="2">How many millilitres of 0.5 M H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> are needed to dissolve 1 L sample containing 0.5 g of copper(II) carbonate?</font>
